name: Tabs
description: Tabs are a set of buttons which allow navigation between content that is related and on the same level of hierarchy.

props.name: selected_key
props.doc: In case one of the tabs should be opened by a `key`.

props.name: align
props.doc: To align the tab list on the right side `align="right"`. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: content_style
props.doc: To enable the visual helper `.dnb-section` on to the content wrapper. Use a supported modifier from the [Section component](/uilib/components/section/properties). Defaults to `null`.

props.name: content_spacing
props.doc: To modify the `spacing` onto the content wrapper. Use a supported modifier from the [Section component](/uilib/components/section/properties). Defaults to `large`.

props.name: tabs_style
props.doc: To enable the visual helper `.dnb-section` inside the tabs list. Use a supported modifier from the [Section component](/uilib/components/section/properties). Defaults to `null`.

props.name: tabs_spacing
props.doc: To modify the `spacing` inside the tab list. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: tab_element
props.doc: Define what HTML element should be used. You can provide e.g. `tab_element={GatsbyLink}` â€“ you may then provide the `to` property inside every entry (`data={[{ to: ';url';, ... }]}`). Defaults to `<button>`.

props.name: children
props.doc: the content to render. Can be a function, returning the current tab content `(key) => ('Current tab')`, a React Component or an object with the keys and content `{key1: 'Current tab'}`.

props.name: content
props.doc: the content to render. Can be a function, returning the current tab content `(key) => ('Current tab')`, a React Component or an object with the keys and content `{key1: 'Current tab'}`.

props.name: prerender
props.doc: If set to `true`, the Tabs content will pre-render all contents. The visibility will be handled by using the `hidden` and `aria-hidden` HTML attributes. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: prevent_rerender
props.doc: If set to `true`, the Tabs content will stay in the DOM. The visibility will be handled by using the `hidden` and `aria-hidden` HTML attributes. Similar to `prerender`, but in contrast, the content will render once the user is activating a tab. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: scroll
props.doc: If set to `true`, the content will scroll on tab change, until all tabs will be visible on the upper side of the browser window view. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: no_border
props.doc: If set to `true`, the default horizontal border line under the tablist will be removed. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: nav_button_edge
props.doc: If set to `true`, the navigation icons will have a straight border at their outside. This feature is meant to be used when the Tabs component goes all the way to the browser window. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: breakout
props.doc: If set to `false`, the default horizontal border line under the tablist remains inside the parent boundaries. Defaults to `true`.

events.name: on_change
events.doc: (preferred) this event gets triggered once the tab changes its selected key. Returns `{ key, selected_key, focus_key, event }`.

events.name: on_click
events.doc: This event gets triggered once the tab gets clicked. Returns `{ key, selected_key, focus_key, event }`.

events.name: on_focus
events.doc: This event gets triggered once the tab changes its focus key. Returns `{ key, selected_key, focus_key, event }`.

events.name: on_mouse_enter
events.doc: This event gets triggered once the user';s mouse enters a tab (hover). Returns `{ key, selected_key, focus_key, event }`.
